[PAWN_nameDef] provided medical care on multiple plague-wracked worlds, always working under the Hippocratic oath. [] improved conditions for those under quarantine while administering complex medical treatments and developing medicines.
[] never had time to enjoy a normal life outside of work.

YoungMaster73.title: Young master
YoungMaster73.desc:
Born to two medics, [PAWN_nameDef] longed for power. [PAWN_possessive] keen intellect and charisma helped [PAWN_objective] gain the respect of [PAWN_possessive] peers.
Deciding that the best way to gain power was to climb the ranks of the imperial military, [] joined at the youngest possible age.

ImperialGeneral39.title: Imperial general
ImperialGeneral39.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef]'s thirst for power defined [PAWN_objective]. [] quickly rose through the military ranks and soon attained the rank of general.
[] was given with the most challenging task - conquering distant and unexplored rim worlds. Victory here could even position [PAWN_objective] as a successor to the emperor.

CaravanTraveler6.title: Caravan traveler
CaravanTraveler6.desc: Born to a family of traveling merchants, [PAWN_nameDef] was mentored by [PAWN_possessive] father in the ways of being a trader. [] was often tasked with caring for the pack animals. Due to [PAWN_possessive] nomadic lifestyle, [] hunted and bartered for [PAWN_possessive] food.

Caravaneer11.title: Caravaneer
Caravaneer11.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef] was the leader of a caravan. [] was responsible for the safety of [PAWN_possessive] caravan and was the head negotiator in countless trade deals.
[] and [PAWN_possessive] people prospered, but their wealth made them a target for brigands. They often had to take up arms to fend off bandits and highwaymen.

JungleKid64.title: Jungle kid
JungleKid64.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef] was abandoned as a newborn, and grew up among the animals of [PAWN_possessive] homeworld’s dense jungles.
When [] was a teenager, a traveling doctor found [PAWN_objective] injured near a road, hissing and meowing. He rescued [PAWN_objective] and took [PAWN_objective] on as an apprentice.

Aromatherapist80.title: Aromatherapist
Aromatherapist80.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] practiced aromatherapy, using essences extracted from home-grown plants.

FarmersSon39.title: Farmer's son
FarmersSon39.desc:
Ade spent much of his childhood learning biome farming. In his biome they kept animals to investigate which would cope best in the alien environment.
Due to this, the travel restrictions and oxygen rationing system, he rarely got to meet anyone from outside his family.

RebelFighter57.title: Rebel fighter
RebelFighter57.desc:
When civil war broke out Ade remained neutral to either side, until his biome was firebombed by a loyalist militia.
Later, his unit gave him the nickname "Rare" after he burnt down the luxury villa of a loyalist leader, with them still inside it.

WealthyStudent75.title: Wealthy student
WealthyStudent75.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef] was born on a wealthy glitterworld. [] studied at the Caspian school of Engineering, and excelled in mathematics and computer programming.
[PAWN_nameDef] grew up in clean, sterile environments. [] never saw a farm or livestock.

Roboticist75.title: roboticist
Roboticist75.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef] felt more comfortable with robots and artificial intelligences than with organic people, so [] worked as a roboticist. [] took a particular interest in mechanites and ancient technology.
[PAWN_nameDef] relied on other people for [PAWN_possessive] basic needs.

StreetPeddler39.title: Street peddler
StreetPeddler39.desc:
Growing up on an industrial midworld where robberies and muggings weren't uncommon, [PAWN_nameDef] helped support his family by making small trinkets and novelties to sell to passers-by.
[] learned early on that it wasn't always what [] knew, but who [] knew that would get [PAWN_objective] far in life.

PrivateDetective66.title: Private detective
PrivateDetective66.desc: As a private eye, sharp wits and a silver tongue were [PAWN_nameDef]'s greatest tools. [] often spent [PAWN_possessive] nights working cases that ranged from uncovering affairs and learning trade secrets to solving murder cases and infiltrating criminal organizations. There wasn't a case [] wouldn't accept for the right price.

BodyguardTrainee88.title: Bodyguard trainee
BodyguardTrainee88.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef] was born into a famously skilled family of bodyguards. [PAWN_possessive] mothers Elena and Victoria forced [PAWN_objective] into many dangerous situations, training [PAWN_objective] to put [PAWN_possessive] client's well-being over [PAWN_possessive] own.
[PAWN_nameDef] was taught about many herbs and natural poisons to help [PAWN_objective] prevent clients from being poisoned.

SpaceBartender66.title: Space bartender
SpaceBartender66.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef] became a bartender on a space station. [] interacted with and befriended many strangers.
As time went on, [PAWN_nameDef] used [PAWN_possessive] knowledge of herbs to craft [PAWN_possessive] own strange concoctions for [PAWN_possessive] customers.

SpoiledChild90.title: spoiled child
SpoiledChild90.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef] was the child of an industrious space engineer. [PAWN_possessive] parents forbade most manual and dangerous tasks, so [] learned art and music instead.
[] loved animals, but [PAWN_possessive] parents never let [PAWN_objective] have a pet - though [] played with other people's pets a lot.

CosmeticSurgeon46.title: Cosmetic surgeon
CosmeticSurgeon46.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef] had a terrible bedside manner due to [PAWN_possessive] abrasiveness. [] often bullied [PAWN_possessive] patients into getting cosmetic surgery. [] made a lot of money this way.
While very studious and careful in [PAWN_possessive] work, [] never had to lift a finger doing domestic chores.

Philosopher40.title: Philosopher
Philosopher40.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef]'s thirst for archaeo-technological knowledge drove [PAWN_objective] to spend years surveying abandoned data centers and studying ancient coding languages.
[] claimed to be one of the few who could piece together the tragedy of the past - and offer a path to the future.

UprightDiplomat39.title: Upright diplomat
UprightDiplomat39.desc:
As a diplomat, [PAWN_nameDef] was assigned to deal with diplomatic tasks in the blood-soaked outer rim sectors.
[] hoped to end the endless wars, until [PAWN_possessive] consularship, the St. Anthem, was attacked by a raider fleet.

CaveChild39.title: cave child
CaveChild39.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef] grew up in a cave on an tundra planet, and was adopted by a traveling group of entertainers known only as the Wizards. Once a starfaring crew, the Wizards told [PAWN_objective] wondrous stories about the universe.
One day, the Wizards did not return from scavenging. After years of waiting, [PAWN_nameDef] set off into space to find them.

VideoProducer32.title: Video producer
VideoProducer32.desc:
Too awkward to socialize, [PAWN_nameDef] found comfort in the production of videos. Oddly, people enjoyed his videos, calling them "perfect sitcom dramas".
[PAWN_nameDef] took advantage of this and broadcast more, ever hopeful that [] would be contacted by the Wizards.

RangerChild95.title: Ranger child
RangerChild95.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef] was raised in a forest. [PAWN_possessive] father taught [PAWN_objective] to hunt and live off the land, so that [] could live without the need of others when father died.
Accustomed to manual labor and with an intuitive mind, [PAWN_nameDef] could survive weeks alone.

BushSniper28.title: Bush sniper
BushSniper28.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef]'s peaceful life was cut short when [PAWN_possessive] country was brutally invaded.
[PAWN_nameDef] was drafted into service as soon as [] was of legal age, and quickly showed an aptitude for rifles. [] spent months living in the forests picking off soldiers who dared cross the border.

GlitterworldRoyal85.title: Glitterworld royal
GlitterworldRoyal85.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef] grew up in a glitterworld royal household. She was groomed from a young age to marry into another planet's royal family.
Unfortunately, her crooked teeth made her undesirable to suitors, so she became bitter and resentful.

PirateSympathizer42.title: Pirate sympathizer
PirateSympathizer42.desc:
From her youth, [PAWN_nameDef] developed connections in the underworld. There she trained in melee combat and became a trusted underworld advisor.
After participating in a failed rebellion, she fled her homeworld to travel with a pirate band.

PlagueSurvivor87.title: Plague survivor
PlagueSurvivor87.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef] watched as a mysterious plague spread through his town, killing his family and friends.
[] learned some medicine from watching the plague doctors, but was mentally scarred by the ordeal.

UnethicalDoctor53.title: Unethical doctor
UnethicalDoctor53.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef] became a doctor to save lives and research medicine. [] soon realized the only way to make progress on [PAWN_possessive] research was to perform experiments on human patients.
[] often used patients for [PAWN_possessive] experiments - whether they were willing or not.

OffworldRecruit21.title: Offworld recruit
OffworldRecruit21.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef] was born an raised in an offworld soldier growth facility. From a very young age, [] was taught close-quarters combat tactics, aggression, and how to survive on distant planets.
One of the best, [PAWN_nameDef] was eventually chose to enter the orbital-deployment shock troop corps.

ShockTrooper89.title: Shock trooper
ShockTrooper89.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef] was in a deep space shock troop unit deployed on multiple planets in various wars.
During a risky assault, [PAWN_possessive] whole unit was wiped out. Nobody else knew what happened on the field that day, but [PAWN_nameDef] will carry the burden forever.

ProdigalStudent4.title: Prodigal student
ProdigalStudent4.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef] was a faithful student, and was dedicated to learning anything and everything he could about humanity and its creations.
While [] was shunned as a nerd, [] didn't mind. [] hoped for a brighter future.

CombatMedtech30.title: Combat medtech
CombatMedtech30.desc:
As a military medtech, [PAWN_nameDef]'s job was to fix and build anything he could get [PAWN_possessive] hands on, from living people to machines and mechs.
Sent into dangerous areas, [] never had a problem saving soldiers' lives and building the technology and machines needed to win.

AnimalCaretaker78.title: Animal caretaker
AnimalCaretaker78.desc:
Born on a medieval farm, [PAWN_nameDef] was tasked with caring for domestic animals. [] grew to love them.
With time, [] learned to tame wild animals. [] dreamed of one day meeting a thrumbo and taming it.

WildlifeRanger87.title: Wildlife ranger
WildlifeRanger87.desc:
Dismayed at the poachers driving several animal species to near-extinction, [PAWN_nameDef] became a wildlife ranger. [] cared for and protect the animals - by force if necessary.
[] grew to hate people slaughtering animals for luxury and profit.

AdventurousYouth67.title: Adventurous youth
AdventurousYouth67.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef] explored all around [PAWN_possessive] family's large estate, uncovering little natural wonders hidden in nearby catacombs, rivers, and caves.
During his teenage years, [PAWN_nameDef] made numerous enemies

TreasureHunter70.title: Treasure hunter
TreasureHunter70.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef] explored outer rim planets in hopes of finding rare treasures.
After succeeding in finding one legendary sculpture, [] was betrayed by [PAWN_possessive] men. [] survived their treasonous attack, but the sculpture was taken.
[] created the Anvil Mercenary Company to help [PAWN_objective] seek revenge.

PilotFan30.title: Pilot fan
PilotFan30.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef]'s father was a starfighter pilot, and [] always idolized the old man.
From a young age, [] collected pilot memorabilia and studied pilot books, preparing to join the deep space navy and follow in [PAWN_possessive] father's footsteps.

StarfighterPilot85.title: Starfighter pilot
StarfighterPilot85.desc:
After years of training and drilling, [PAWN_nameDef] finally became a starfighter pilot.
Hundreds of combat missions later, [] grew bored and started seeking newer thrills. [] joined a band of space pirates, which eagerly welcomed [PAWN_objective] because of [PAWN_possessive] piloting skill.

MedicalHelper94.title: Medical helper
MedicalHelper94.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef] traveled between rim worlds with [PAWN_possessive] family. [PAWN_nameDef]'s mother, a renowned doctor, often delivered lectures from the hull of their retrofitted cargo/medical ship.
Sometimes, the family took on difficult long-term medical work with especially needy patients, and [PAWN_nameDef] helped where he could.

GangSoldier95.title: Gang soldier
GangSoldier95.desc:
Living for many years between three raider settlements, [PAWN_nameDef] persevered through many challenges: a spacecraft implosion, cryptostasis, crashlanding on a miserable dustball of a planet, and nursing an old man back to health, and many of battles.
[] eventually took control of a violent gang.

CountryChild95.title: Country child
CountryChild95.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] was raised up to fear God and love [PAWN_possessive] country. [] was a genuine backwoods kid. [] always worked hard to earn respect rather than demanding it.

SpaceMarine81.title: space marine
SpaceMarine81.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef] joined Interplanetary Marines to travel the stars fight for [PAWN_possessive] planet. [] distinguished himself in several battles.
[PAWN_possessive] experiences desensitized him to people around him, and his social skills degraded. But, he did learn how to fight.

RebelWriter82.title: Rebel writer
RebelWriter82.desc: Early on, [PAWN_nameDef] developed a talent for writing. [] was soon writing a popular online journal - anonymously, to hide [PAWN_possessive] age - on topics ranging from bioethics to political theory and xenosociology.

Adventurer27.title: Adventurer
Adventurer27.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef]'s thirst for adventure took [PAWN_objective] to many planets. [] visited the brightest glitterworlds and the darkest war-torn toxic planets in [PAWN_possessive] quest to find novelty and excitement.
[] worked as little as possible, often skirting ethical boundaries to make a quick buck. Among all jobs, [] hated cooking the most.

ExiledPrince97.title: Exiled prince
ExiledPrince97.desc:
A member of a royal family, [PAWN_nameDef] was exiled for shaming [PAWN_possessive] family.
Living in a foreign land, mostly alone, [] spent most of [PAWN_possessive] time making huts and houses to live in. [] found little time in an average day for enjoyment, and lost all his friends and family.

BloodyWanderer71.title: Bloody wanderer
BloodyWanderer71.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef] was a wanderer, traveling from town to town, taking odd jobs and stealing to live.
One day, he had a mental break and went on a long rampage, destroying several towns and killing many. [] eventually calmed, but [PAWN_possessive] bloodlust never left [PAWN_objective].

NewAgeDuelist79.title: New age duelist
NewAgeDuelist79.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef] was fascinated with combat. [PAWN_possessive] parents traveled often, so [] was able to sample many different fighting styles, from 76th-wave jujutsu to the infamous 'urbvilág-style' karate.
A polite child, most fighters accepted [PAWN_possessive] requests for training - but moving around often without finishing a tutelage made [PAWN_objective] lazy.

PirateDoctor34.title: Pirate doctor
PirateDoctor34.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef] had a passion for medicine, but never bothered to get a medical degree. Only underfunded pirates and terrorists were desperate enough to hire [PAWN_possessive] services, and [PAWN_possessive] surgical patients had about a 50% survival rate.
Despite this, [PAWN_possessive] optimistic attitude drove [PAWN_objective] to keep trying to heal those in need. As long as they paid up front.

SpoiledBrat31.title: Spoiled brat
SpoiledBrat31.desc:
Born in a rich family, [PAWN_nameDef] was given everything, and never developed basic work ethic or the foundations of a non-dependent personality.
[] was expected to become one of the best doctors in the world.

BloodyDentist9.title: Bloody dentist
BloodyDentist9.desc:
After studying at a famous college, [PAWN_nameDef]'s weak personality eventually snapped under the strain of angry administrators and whining patients. [] went on a secret murder spree, killing many of those under [PAWN_possessive] care.
After a pursuit, [] managed to escape [PAWN_possessive] planet and travel to a new world.

CowFarmer39.title: Cow farmer
CowFarmer39.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef] grew up on a rim world, under the tyranny of [PAWN_possessive] father, who forced [PAWN_objective] to work every day on the farm. [] dreamed of escaping [PAWN_possessive] father and exploring the universe.
One day, when the trade ship was overhead, [] stowed away among the goods in the launch pods, and escaped into space.

MasterChef90.title: Master chef
MasterChef90.desc:
On a glitterworld, [PAWN_nameDef] found a job washing dishes at a famous restaurant and worked [PAWN_possessive] way up the ranks.
A few years later, [PAWN_possessive] career came to an end when someone poisoned the meal [] was preparing for the mayor. Jobless, [] and left to explore the stars once again.

DiscardedYouth13.title: Discarded youth
DiscardedYouth13.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef] grew up isolated on a trash planet. A dumping ground for surrounding glitterworlds, it was a harsh home. As a baby, [] sucked on the tap of a discarded nutrient paste dispenser for comfort.
In these desperate circumstances, against all odds, [] survived - and thrived.

Mercenary9.title: mercenary
Mercenary9.desc:
After escaping his home planet, [PAWN_nameDef] fell in with a band of mercenaries. [] fought alongside his brothers and sisters in arms for many years.
One day, they were caught in a fight they couldn't win. Refusing to retreat, [PAWN_nameDef] was shot down by his enemies. [] was alarmed to awake in a heap of corpses, mysteriously unharmed.

DisasterSurvivor9.title: katasztrófa túlélő
DisasterSurvivor9.desc: [PAWN_nameDef]'s planet collided with a small moon. Everything he knew as home was destroyed, and his entire family died. [] was left in the ruins to fend for himself.

ExplorerWriter52.title: Explorer-writer
ExplorerWriter52.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef] traveled from planet to planet, gathering samples, stories, and research.
[PAWN_possessive] goal was to bring together enough knowledge to make a survival guide for future generations.

RebelChild95.title: Rebel child
RebelChild95.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef] was born under authoritarian rule. Despite intense oppression from family and community, she never gave up fighting for her dignity and her freedom.
She was often put into hopeless situations where even family would try to terrorize her into propriety. She learned to trust no one.

MilitiaSoldier63.title: Militia soldier
MilitiaSoldier63.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef] joined the militia forces and fought for rights and peace.
After her homeworld was unexpectedly destroyed in the wars, she traveled great distances, seeking a refuge where she could build a new, free way of life.

MidworldCadet91.title: Midworld cadet
MidworldCadet91.desc:
Growing up on a high-tech midworld with a flourishing space transit industry, [PAWN_nameDef] wished to leave for the stars and live among the growing spacer class.
[] excelled in [PAWN_possessive] studies, and gained entry to [PAWN_possessive] homeworld's most prestigious naval academy.

WarshipCaptain35.title: Warship captain
WarshipCaptain35.desc:
Years of being commanding officer of an advanced corvette taught [PAWN_nameDef] the art of leadership, the techniques of higher engineering, and how to stay calm while enemies try to kill you.
Unfortunately, [PAWN_nameDef] only very rarely had contact with nature.

ForestChild83.title: forest child
ForestChild83.desc:
When [] was a baby, [PAWN_nameDef]'s mother went insane and left [PAWN_objective] in the woods.
Raised by wild people, [PAWN_nameDef] was known for both loving and killing animals.

ForestProwler15.title: Erdei ember
ForestProwler15.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] led a band of wild men in the forest. They foraged for food, hunted, and sometimes murdered more civilized people to steal their shiny objects.

VatgrownScientist57.title: Vatgrown scientist
VatgrownScientist57.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef] was grown to be a perfect scientist, with a mind perfectly tuned for physics and chemistry.
[PAWN_possessive] creators used [PAWN_objective] as a teaching aid on mind design, hoping [] would eventually grow to be a great mind and continue their research.

RunawayDancer13.title: Runaway dancer
RunawayDancer13.desc:
Grown by and for science, [PAWN_nameDef] gave it up. Instead, [] wanted to dance for crowds across many worlds, from the glamor of the glitterworlds to the dangers of the rim.
Such work required wearing a smile on [PAWN_possessive] face and a pistol under [PAWN_possessive] costume.

MusicIdol48.title: Music idol
MusicIdol48.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef] was the only daughter of a powerful company president. [PAWN_possessive] beautiful appearance led to a career as a music idol.
When [PAWN_possessive] mother died, [PAWN_nameDef] could not bear [PAWN_possessive] father's loneliness, and became his sexual companion.

ProstituteIdol94.title: Prostitute idol
ProstituteIdol94.desc:
After [PAWN_possessive] father was deposed, [PAWN_nameDef]'s beauty led [PAWN_objective] to be forced into pornography to survive.
Over years of difficult treatments, [PAWN_possessive] body was remodeled to appear temporarily ageless. Sold to an orbital brothel, [] became popular, with a steady stream of clients from all over the planet.

SicklyLiar84.title: Sickly liar
SicklyLiar84.desc:
It is not uncommon for a sickly child to be cast away. What is uncommon is for that child to survive and even thrive with such a weak body.
Using his quick wit and silver tongue, Lynn was able to get out of almost any situation - most of the time at the cost others around him.

SicklyLawyer86.title: Sickly lawyer
SicklyLawyer86.desc:
As a lawyer, Lynn could convict a deaf man for stealing music. His sharp mind and lack of empathy let him say anything to get the other person to talk. With the right amount of money, he knew, any case can be won.
His childhood cough never went away.

IceworldSurvivor77.title: Iceworld survivor
IceworldSurvivor77.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef] was born on an iceworld. Survival depended on staying together and building with nothing.
[] got used to the cold. [] never got used to dealing with those strange green things called plants.

Tinkerer86.title: Tinkerer
Tinkerer86.desc:
"How does this work?
Why does this move?
Maybe if I change this... oops, I hope it works better... or maybe I broke it..."

TragicLoner67.title: Tragic loner
TragicLoner67.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef] was involved in a traumatic accident that resulted in [PAWN_objective] killing [PAWN_possessive] own family.
Cast out from society, [] was left with only [PAWN_possessive] animal companions and several engineering textbooks to keep [PAWN_objective] company.

RocketPioneer89.title: Rocket pioneer
RocketPioneer89.desc:
As a self-taught engineer, [PAWN_nameDef] escaped his dying homeworld on a rocket [] built [PAWN_objective]self.
[] later spent years of his life on several worlds, helping less-developed planets develop rocket technology.

AntisocialChild59.title: Antisocial child
AntisocialChild59.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef] lacked typical social skills, and avoided social interaction.
[] gained satisfaction only from steady work. [] especially disliked speaking with overly creative or outgoing individuals.

ArmySergeant7.title: Army sergeant
ArmySergeant7.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef] served in [PAWN_possessive] nation's military, commanding small units as a non-commissioned officer.
[] excelled creating tactically sound plans despite difficult circumstances.

YoungPirate51.title: Young pirate
YoungPirate51.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef] was born to pirates, in a dirty metal room that smelled of motor oil.
[] was never exactly taught anything, but [] still learned the ways of survival, barter, and combat.

StellarPirate89.title: Stellar pirate
StellarPirate89.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef] was captain of a pirate ship. [] and his crew made their living capturing traders who wandered off-course.
[] was known for [PAWN_possessive] balanced approach to problems, building, fighting, or negotiating as needed.

SoldierExperiment32.title: Soldier experiment
SoldierExperiment32.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef] grew up believing [] was a normal, albeit slightly sheltered child.
In truth, [] was part of an elaborate experiment. Researchers were conditioning [PAWN_objective] using social interactions and mechanite injections to try to produce an elite soldier.

LostSoldier79.title: Lost soldier
LostSoldier79.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef]'s childhood soldier conditioning failed, and the experiment was shut down. [] was abandoned, purposeless, friendless.
[PAWN_nameDef] eventually found solace in physically demanding work. [] especially liked building houses and crafting heavy armor.

DedicatedStudent33.title: Dedicated student
DedicatedStudent33.desc:
The child of a wealthy manufacturer, [PAWN_nameDef] was pampered from an early age. [] developed an affinity for reading and art, and a distaste for menial chores.
A revolution brought his father's businesses under state control. Penniless, [PAWN_nameDef] worked hard to complete [PAWN_possessive] education.

LanguageAnalyst27.title: Language analyst
LanguageAnalyst27.desc:
After war broke out on [PAWN_possessive] homeworld, [PAWN_nameDef] was conscripted as a linguist. [] spent [PAWN_possessive] days in a space station, decoding enemy communications and tending the hydroponic crops.
After a meteorite damaged the station, [] was forced to enter cryptosleep and hope for rescue.

Infantry14.title: Infantry
Infantry14.desc:
Lenka was raised on a world wracked by war.
At an early age, she was shown how to use guns and cruelty to project her will. She later distinguished herself by committing atrocities with more enthusiasm than anyone else.

PrisonerOfWar89.title: Prisoner of war
PrisonerOfWar89.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef] was captured and put on death row for war crimes.
Fortunately for her, someone cut the power to her cell block. Riots ignited. Guards and trained wargs were deployed to quell the uprising. Organizing a few other inmates, [PAWN_nameDef] escaped in a small spacecraft.

AngryStudent94.title: Angry student
AngryStudent94.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef] trained towards [PAWN_possessive] dream of working for his hometown's local council.
For reasons he never quite understood, [] was bullied relentlessly by his classmates. [] chose to repress his rage.

MadAccountant43.title: Mad accountant
MadAccountant43.desc:
As an accountant, [PAWN_nameDef] often socialized with colleagues, and made many friends in upper management.
One day, [PAWN_nameDef] discovered a corruption racket run by some of [PAWN_possessive] bosses. After reporting this, [] was fired. Wishing to hunt down those responsible, [] went on a mass murder spree.

TransferStudent51.title: Transfer student
TransferStudent51.desc:
A midworld child, [PAWN_nameDef]'s wealthy parents sent [PAWN_objective] to a nearby glitterworld to receive a better education.
[PAWN_nameDef] was a talented student. However, due to his family's wealth, [] never had to do dumb labor.

Politician1.title: Politician
Politician1.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef] was an activist in a powerful political faction. There [] learned the art of persuasion and speech.
[] had many enemies, so [] took secret courses in shooting and hand-to-hand combat.

DesertRat41.title: Desert rat
DesertRat41.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef] was born to a tribe of desert ascetics who wandered the endless wastes.
They sought a mythical substance they believed could liberate them from ignorance through psychedelic revelation - and usher in a new period of interstellar peace.

Philosopher15.title: philosopher
Philosopher15.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef]'s thirst for archaeo-technological knowledge drove [PAWN_objective] to spend years surveying abandoned data centers and studying ancient coding languages.
[] claimed to be one of the few who could piece together the tragedy of the past - and offer a path to the future.

ArtisticWeirdo34.title: Artistic weirdo
ArtisticWeirdo34.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef] grew up in a house near a bustling midworld metropolis.
[] was talented at art and creative work, but often acted strangely, and thus had few friends.

AdventurousWeirdo23.title: Adventurous weirdo
AdventurousWeirdo23.desc:
A creative but strange individual, [PAWN_nameDef] dedicated his life to his twin passions of medieval world history and high technology.
[] was fascinated by the idea of becoming a 'skyknight' with glittering armor and a giant sword.

ApprenticeOracle89.title: Apprentice oracle
ApprenticeOracle89.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef] was chosen at an early age by the village elders to keep the sacred rituals of the Oracle.
An irrepressibly curious child, [PAWN_nameDef] caused a religious crisis for [PAWN_possessive] tribe when [] accidentally flipped a switch to open the "tombs" of the Gods - cryptosleep caskets inhabited by some very confused ancestors.

CasketBuilder70.title: Casket builder
CasketBuilder70.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef] was fascinated with cryosleep, and spent [PAWN_possessive] life learning about the mysterious technology.
Working as an assembler on a midworld, [PAWN_nameDef] built an experimental prototype casket from discarded parts. Unfortunately, while [] was searching for the final component, [PAWN_possessive] home was leveled by a bomb.

JunkyardMechanic57.title: Junkyard mechanic
JunkyardMechanic57.desc:
Left for dead at a young age, [PAWN_nameDef] was rescued by an old man who ran an urbworld junkyard. The old man forced [PAWN_nameDef] to do dangerous, demanding work.
[PAWN_nameDef] became very familiar with machines, but [] grew up with almost no other experiences.

MilitaryOfficer99.title: Military officer
MilitaryOfficer99.desc:
Obsessed with interstellar travel, [PAWN_nameDef] left [PAWN_possessive] desolate life behind to join a military academy in hopes of becoming a pilot.
[] was trained in advanced combat and survival skills. While [] excelled in [PAWN_possessive] studies, [PAWN_nameDef] was a loner and never cared about [PAWN_possessive] crewmates.

Empath97.title: Empath
Empath97.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef] was an incredibly empathetic child, so much that [] was totally overwhelmed by simple social interactions. Once, [] stepped on a bug and felt so guilty [] cried for an hour.
[PAWN_nameDef] did try to use a gun one time, but it went very poorly, as the loud noise made [PAWN_objective] flinch uncontrollably.

FearfulChef3.title: Fearful chef
FearfulChef3.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef] was a excellent chef who worked in a high-end restaurant.
One day, [] left the stove on, and accidentally burned down the whole building. This event shook [PAWN_objective] so much that [] swore to never touch a stove again.

AnimalLabTech51.title: animal lab tech
AnimalLabTech51.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef] worked as a technician in a lab studying animals.
[] spent [PAWN_possessive] days taking care of the animals and cleaning up after them. [] dreamed of having [PAWN_possessive] own lab one day.

MuffaloResearcher39.title: muffalo researcher
MuffaloResearcher39.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef] specialized in studying and manipulating the genetic code of the muffalo.
[PAWN_possessive] work left little time to develop an appreciation for the arts or other people's company.

ShipChild0.title: Ship child
ShipChild0.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef]'s family were space traders. One day, [PAWN_nameDef]'s cryptosleep pod failed in transit. [] had to spend years awake on the ship as the other slept.
[] filled [PAWN_possessive] days creating beautiful contraptions from the ship's cargo - but [] didn't learn a lot of basic planetary living skills.

ArtifactHunter22.title: Artifact hunter
ArtifactHunter22.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef] became depressed and lost interest in life. [] travelled from planet to planet, searching for psychic artifacts amid mechanoid ruins in the hope that they would cure the pain in [PAWN_possessive] soul.
A steady trigger finger and careful planning kept [PAWN_nameDef] alive.

PetKeeper87.title: Pet keeper
PetKeeper87.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef] spent most of [PAWN_possessive] childhood tending the animals [] had bought or rescued.
[] saw beauty in natural things more than fabricated objects, and chose the company of [PAWN_possessive] animals over that of [PAWN_possessive] peers.

Herpetologist17.title: Herpetologist
Herpetologist17.desc:
After a terrible mining accident, [PAWN_nameDef] set off into space in search of exotic new animal species.
[] hoped to leave [PAWN_possessive] past behind and find long-lived companions. [] knew the pain of loss too well.

ChildResearcher10.title: Child researcher
ChildResearcher10.desc:
A frightfully intelligent child, [PAWN_nameDef] was kidnapped by a glitterworld corporation and forced to research technologies for weaponizing anti-matter.
[] vowed never to invent anything again.

Fugitive22.title: Fugitive
Fugitive22.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef] rebelled against the corporation [] worked for. [] failed, and was forced him to go on the run.
[] was always on the move, always leaving everything behind. [] tried to gain supporters for [PAWN_possessive] cause, but failed due to [PAWN_possessive] poor social skills.

VidtubeStar84.title: Vidtube star
VidtubeStar84.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef]'s hobby was making videos for the popular video sharing service Vidtube. [] made everything from video game reviews to pasta cooking guides.
[] gained a over a million followers.

GunDealer84.title: Gun dealer
GunDealer84.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef] traded high-tech firearms between warring factions.
Over time, [] became very skilled at conducting product demonstrations and negotiating profitable deals.

CorporateSlave4.title: corporate slave
CorporateSlave4.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef] grew up in a colony owned by a large glitterworld corporation. All children had virtual reality devices attached by force, and were raised in a brutal digital world.
Constantly forced to fight others for the entertainment of the wealthy, gunplay and tactics became the center of [PAWN_nameDef]'s universe.

ColonyEngineer46.title: colony engineer
ColonyEngineer46.desc:
The children took over the facility, and they declared independence from the corporation.
[PAWN_nameDef] had used the VR system to become a master engineer, and he worked diligently to prepare the colony for the corporation's inevitable return.

AspiringPhysicist3.title: Aspiring physicist
AspiringPhysicist3.desc:
The daughter of an engineer and doctor, [PAWN_nameDef]'s early life was intellectually rich. After visiting a physics lab, she decided she wanted to be a quantum physicist.
Bitten by a camel, kicked off a horse, and chased by dogs, [PAWN_nameDef] developed a fear of animals.

DeepSpaceSurveor51.title: Deep space surveor
DeepSpaceSurveor51.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef] was a deep space surveyor. She studied which worlds were the most suitable for colonization.
Her expeditions were met by hostile natives, green-painted space-women, and wannabe Greek gods. Surviving many firefights, she learned to build rudimentary lathes and rock cannons to fend off enemies.

QuietNerd17.title: quiet nerd
QuietNerd17.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef] was raised by doting parents on a midworld. Instead of playing with other children, [] read books voraciously.
[] was not particularly rugged, and struggled with physical labor.

CostumeCrafter79.title: costume crafter
CostumeCrafter79.desc:
By day, [PAWN_nameDef] was an office worker on a midworld. At night, [] designed and built elaborate monster costumes for science fiction conventions.
[] learned a great deal about sewing. Unfortunately this came at the cost of being able to cook anything more complex than an instant meal.

SpacerOrphan95.title: spacer orphan
SpacerOrphan95.desc:
Born among stars to a spacefaring family, the [PAWN_nameDef] was the only survivor when [PAWN_possessive] family's ship was destroyed.
[] was forced to find a way to survive, and seek the joy of knowing another family.

Gunfighter83.title: gunfighter
Gunfighter83.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef] was a deadly shot. Peace wasn't for him. [] found [PAWN_possessive] family among the brothers and sisters that [] spent years fighting alongside.
After most of those close to [PAWN_objective] died, [] once again set off to lend [PAWN_possessive] gun to those who needed it - or those who could pay.

SmallTownKid91.title: small town kid
SmallTownKid91.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef] grew up in an isolated midworld village, surrounded by opticows and countryside.
[PAWN_possessive] parents taught [PAWN_objective] a wide range of useful domestic skills, but a peaceful and secure childhood left [PAWN_objective] with little understanding of the harder parts of life.

RenownedProfessor95.title: renowned professor
RenownedProfessor95.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef]'s bottomless compassion and love of knowledge drove [PAWN_objective] to a life of teaching. [] became one of the best-known names in academia throughout the urbworld bubble.
[PAWN_possessive] holo-lectures were revered by all that watched, and the few students [] accepted into [PAWN_possessive] seminars spoke widely of [PAWN_possessive] kindness and patience.

SteamworldTinker44.title: steamworld tinker
SteamworldTinker44.desc:
In the slums of a steamworld, [PAWN_nameDef] developed a fascination with machines and contraptions. [] found [] preferred their company to that of other people.
[PAWN_possessive] remarkable dexterity earned [PAWN_objective] a steady stream of pocket change, and [] spent every penny on spare parts and tools to play with.

NavyTechOfficer30.title: navy tech officer
NavyTechOfficer30.desc:
After repairing a fleet admiral's holoscreen with nothing but a pair of rusty pliers and scrap wire, [PAWN_nameDef] was invited to the Federation Naval Academy.
[] received an excellent technical education and extensive firearms training, but had no interest in studying more menial skills.

AbandonedOrphan9.title: abandoned orphan
AbandonedOrphan9.desc:
Abandoned at birth, young [PAWN_nameDef] started [PAWN_possessive] life in an orphanage.
A rascal and a scoundrel, [] became a clever troublemaker.

KingOfPirates25.title: Kalózkirály
KingOfPirates25.desc: As a self-proclaimed king of pirates, [PAWN_nameDef] was ruthless. Manipulative in nature, [] was not afraid to sacrifice the people around [PAWN_objective] in service of [PAWN_possessive] own goals. [] was a good shot, but even more skilled with a sword, and [] loved the adrenaline rush of close combat.

SpaceNerd97.title: Űrkocka
SpaceNerd97.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] just wanted to be cool like [PAWN_possessive] favorite superhero All-Might. [] dreamed of going on space adventures and exploring new worlds. [] also dreamed of chocolate... space chocolate.

SpaceNavyTech66.title: space navy tech
SpaceNavyTech66.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef] was in a space navy for the the most powerful planet in the local star group. [] developed skills in maintenance, electronic systems, radar and imaging, and logistics management.
[] served with pride and patriotic love for [PAWN_possessive] planet.

ChildSpy42.title: child spy
ChildSpy42.desc:
Children are often presumed innocent, and so make ideal spies. [PAWN_nameDef] was trained in the arts of infiltration and information-gathering when [] was very young.
[PAWN_possessive] spent years behind enemy lines, gathering intel in a brutal planetary war. During this time, [] had limited opportunity for education.

Defector99.title: defector
Defector99.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef] decided to leave the oppressive dictatorship where [] lived. [PAWN_possessive] defection was not well-received, and agents were sent after [PAWN_objective].
[] spent years on the run. Since [] could trust no doctor, [] treated [PAWN_possessive] own wounds. The ordeal made [PAWN_objective] bitter and untrusting.

TurtleHerder92.title: turtle herder
TurtleHerder92.desc:
Born to settler folk, [PAWN_nameDef]'s family' had a beloved herd of turtles, who protected them by absorbing shots from raiders.
At a young age, [] was entrusted with the turtles. [] bred them, successfully - too successfully. The massive turtle herds consumed every food source and destroyed the local ecosystem.

SpaceMarineMedic28.title: space marine medic
SpaceMarineMedic28.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef] joined a colony contact expeditionary force as a medic. The mission turned bad when the colonists turned out to be suffering from a zombifying disease. [] ran and fought for days.
Cornered with wounded men, [] sprayed enough ammunition to wear out four machine gun barrels, and learned the value of high-volume fire. But [PAWN_possessive] nickname, Noob, stuck from that day forward.

ComputerGeek28.title: computer geek
ComputerGeek28.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef] spent most of [PAWN_possessive] childhood on [PAWN_possessive] computer, typing away, never knowing when to get up and eat.
He had a very narrow interest: hacking cryptobiotic safety protocols.

Technician24.title: technician
Technician24.desc:
As an IT technician, [PAWN_nameDef] didn't have much time to write code any more.
[] got called to work all the time to fix failures in the cryptobiotic chamber and AI subroutine misalignments.

Freethinker52.title: freethinker
Freethinker52.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef] grew up on a toxic world with tyrannical leaders. While the rest of the population was high on the planet's narcotic exports, [] joined a rebel militia.
After a risky operation against the regime failed, [] fled the planet, staying alive by threatening mutual annihilation with a planetcracker antimatter bomb.

MercenaryLord80.title: mercenary lord
MercenaryLord80.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef] formed a mercenary company out of freelancers who wanted to make good money while also making slightly better-than-average moral choices. [] called it the Ashmarines.
To avoid the core worlds' military forces, [] moved his company to the rim worlds. There, [] established bases and communities. In ruling, [] maintained a form of order among the raiders and madmen of deep space.

Punk30.title: Punk
Punk30.desc: [PAWN_nameDef] spent his childhood selling knockoff cigarettes to 15-year-olds. The cigarettes were often full of grass clippings.

GameDeveloper95.title: Game developer
GameDeveloper95.desc:
[PAWN_nameDef] was an independent game developer.
After an early success, [PAWN_nameDef]'s career quickly degenerated into a circus of misguided ideas, deals gone wrong, and desperate, failed PR stunts.
